Description: Rectangular wooden tablet bearing 4 lines of Demotic,simple financila tender (Vleeming) or oracular text (Declaration of Tetatawa OR Oracle Question of Tetatawa). In the text we can find the following names: Tetatawa; Tapadiamun; Tapeuo(?) daughter of; Tanesmin; -osiris; Esmin; Amenhotep, son of Hapu
Authority: Issuer: Amenhotep, Son of Hapu ((royal scribe))
Curator's comments: Some editions spuriously suggest Oxyrhynchos as the provenance based on earlier EES documentation, but the contents suggest Thebes; text reads, "Declaration of the servant, woman Tetetawa ---(?), daughter of Esmin, before her chief, royal scribe Amen[hotep, son of Hapu: I will give 300 deben, their half 150 deben, equal to 300 deben again ---- I will winnow(?) ---" Other Reference: Migahid 1987: no. 11; DBL 2005 676; Farid 1995: p. 190 no. 16
Bibliographic references: Brunsch 1982-83 / Acht Holztafeln aus dem Britischen Museum, London (no. 5, 37-38.)
Vleeming 2015 / Demotic graffiti and other short texts gathered from many publications (no.2106, p.397)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (48781) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/48781)
